definition: a district or an area of a town; the people who live there
the area that you are in or the area near a particular place
approximately; not exactly
a member of a group of women who, in the UK and the US in the early part of the 20th century, organized a campaign for the right of women to vote in political elections
making a ‘s’ or ‘sh’ sound
a situation in which many things are destroyed and many people killed, especially because of a war or a fire
the killing of millions of Jewish people by the German Nazi government in the period 1941–5
the piece of string in the centre of a candle that you light so that the candle burns
the piece of material in an oil lamp that takes in the oil and that you light so that the lamp burns
to annoy somebody
to open the buttons on a piece of clothing
being the same age or having the same date of origin
a person who sleeps in a particular way
a person who is asleep
a night train with beds for passengers on it
a coach on a train with beds for people to sleep in
one of the heavy pieces of wood or concrete (= a hard building material) on which the rails (= metal bars) on a railway track are laid
a film, play or book that for a long time is not very successful and then is suddenly a success
a spy who is sent to live in a country as a normal citizen and is not used until much later
a ring or piece of metal that you wear in an ear that has been pierced (= had a hole made in it) to keep the hole from closing
a disease similar to dengue caused by a virus, found in East Africa and parts of Asia and carried by mosquitoes
the condition of having too high a level of blood sugar
